citeinfo.origin: Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Kodiak Facility PO Box 1638, Kodiak, AK 99615.
citeinfo.title: Eastern Bering Sea Survey: King and Tanner Crab

abstract.p: An annual trawl survey is conducted in the eastern Bering Sea to provide information on the distribution and abundance of four species of crabs - red king crab, blue king crab, and two species of Tanner crab. This information is provided to fishermen and processors as an aid in locating productive areas and judging the overall availability of crabs. Survey derived information is also used as part of the basis for management decisions. An additional report dealing with king crabs was released in September, 1978.

[Reference: OTTO, R. S., R. A. MacINTOSH, A. K. FUKUYAMA, T. M. ARMETTA, and C.J. PACE. 1979. Report to industry on 1979 eastern Bering Sea survey King and Tanner crab. NWAFC Processed Rep. 79-14, 54 p. Northwest and Alaska Fish. Cent., Natl. Mar. Fish. Serv., NOAA, Kodiak Facility PO Box 1638, Kodiak, AK 99615.]

descript.purpose: To report survey results of King and Tanner crab.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
